Sentencas: Sulfur, omnipresent in fossil fuels and biomass, causes substantial industrial challenges and significant environmental harm when released to the atmosphere.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: Efficient and cost-effective integration of sulfur removal into high-temperature industrial processes calls for temperature compatible strategies, and solid sorbents offer the most promising solution.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: This article presents C-H-O ternary diagrams as visual tools for fundamental evaluation of potential sulfur uptake capacity of solid sorbents.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: The findings of this study are based on thermodynamic analyses and highlight how the C/H/O ratio of the fuel feedstock as well as the gasification or oxidation agent affect sulfur uptake capacity of the sorbents.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: The thermodynamic effect of changing temperature (T = 1000-1400 K) and pressure (P = 1-10 atm) on sorbent sulfur uptake is also explored.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: In this study, Ca- and Sr-based sorbents are investigated, but C-H-O ternary diagrams could be calculated for any other potential solid sorbent.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: Important thermodynamic insights are drawn from the C-H-O ternary equilibria.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: Importantly, the initial sulfur content of the fuel does not affect the thermodynamic limit of the sorbent, which is primarily a function of the overall C/H/O ratio of the fuel + gasification or oxidation agent.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: Under reducing conditions, the total gas-phase sulfur concentration depends strongly on the water vapor partial pressure.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: Moreover, operating at stoichiometric oxygen conditions results in poor sorbent sulfur uptake with a rapid rise in SO2 mole fraction.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams

Sentencas: The article also offers important insights to predict the most favorable conditions for the use of solid sorbents that can mitigate anode deactivation in solid oxide-based carbon fuel cells.
Titulo: Insights into Sulfur Uptake by Solid Sorbents from Fossil Fuels and Biomass: Revisiting C-H-O Ternary Diagrams
